intro: Fimbristylis scabrida, commonly known as the rough hairgrass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial grass-like plant characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wetland and marshy habitats. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its ecological importance lies in its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
